course_consists.point1: 1. Basic theory (What is testing, bug reports, documentation, types, methods, testing directions, etc.) SDLC, STLC.

course_consists.point3: 3. HTTP Methods of requests to the server.

course_consists.point5: 5. Structures of HTTP requests and responses.

course_consists.point6: 6. What is JSON, XML. Their structure.

course_consists.point7: 7. API testing via Postman (JS, API autotests).

course_consists.point8: 8. Removing and reading logs from an external server.

course_consists.point9: 9. Sniffing http web traffic via Charles and Fiddler.

course_consists.point10: 10. Dev Tools of web browsers (Google Chrome, FireFox).

course_consists.point11: 11. VPN. How it works, why you need it, how to use it, tool options.

course_consists.point15: 15. Building Android applications on Android Studio.

course_consists.point17: 17. Setting up proxy and vpn on iOS and Android.

course_consists.point18: 18. Interception (sniffing) of mobile traffic via Charles and Fiddler on iOS and Android.

course_consists.point19: 19. Command line  - terminal, Linux - copying, creating, viewing, moving files on servers without a graphical interface.

course_consists.point20: 20. Basics of bash scripting, automation of routine tasks on the server.

course_consists.point22: 22. SQL basics (create, delete, delete, insert, select from, where to, join).

course_consists.point24: 24. Non-relational database Redis (installation, configuration and use).

course_consists.point27: 27.Python. Learning the basics. Creating a client-server application.
